newsitem.title: UK: Barclays shares hit record high.
newsitem.headline: Barclays shares hit record high.

text.p: Shares in Barclays Bank Plc hit a record high on Thursday, with traders saying that vague talk of a further share buyback was lending support although volumes remained thin.
Barclays shares were 14p higher at 1030p by 1045 GMT, having earlier touched a record high of 1031.
Barclays repurchased 55 million of its shares -- some 3.5 percent of its share capital -- in August.
That was the bank's third share buy-back, following earlier repurchases in August 1995 and February of this year. It has spent almost one billion stg in the process.
Electricity generator PowerGen on Thursday announced that it was buying back five percent of its capital and the market began to cast around for other possible repurchase schemes.
Traders said there was also some switching out of Abbey National into Barclays. Abbey National, a strong performer in recent days, shed 8 1/2p to 698p.
